hedline.hl1: World Briefing | Americas: Canada: Making Kyoto Pact Official

abstract.p: Canada joins host of international industrial powers and ratifies Kyoto Protocol, which seeks to reduce harmful heat-trapping emissions; pact was not ratified by Bush administration last year (S)

block.p: Canada formally ratified the Kyoto Protocol, the climate treaty rejected last year by the Bush administration but accepted by almost all other industrial powers. The treaty, once enacted, will require participating industrialized countries by 2012 to reduce emissions of heat-trapping greenhouse gases below levels measured in 1990. Canadians voiced strong support for the treaty in opinion polls, but provinces with significant reserves of coal and oil, notably Alberta, opposed it. Those fuels are the dominant source of carbon dioxide, the main greenhouse gas.
